page.title: 09Bolam Lake Country Park
page.content: Bolam Lake Country Park (Lake 10 ha total extent 37 ha) was constructed about 1817 by Lord Decies of Bolam.It was bought by Northumberland County Council in 1972 for use as a Country Park. Entry is free and it is always open. Three carparks have a capacity for 250 cars but on busy days roadside parking can increase this number to 500. An estimated 150,000 people visit the Park each year including up to 70 school parties. There is a permanent warden with 3 voluntary assistants at weekends. There are facilities for canoeing,fishing, orienteering and ornithological, biological, geographical, historical and environmental science studies.
